vocabulary.definition: a huge group of stars and planets in space
vocabulary.example: Our Earth is in the Milky Way galaxy

vocabulary.definition: a large round object that travels around a star
vocabulary.example: Mars is the red planet in our solar system

vocabulary.definition: a powerful vehicle that can fly into space
vocabulary.example: The rocket blasted off toward the moon

vocabulary.definition: a rocky object that floats in space
vocabulary.example: The asteroid was as big as a mountain

vocabulary.definition: the path a planet or moon takes around something bigger
vocabulary.example: The moon's orbit around Earth takes about a month

vocabulary.definition: a space object made of ice and dust with a bright tail
vocabulary.example: The comet's tail stretched across the night sky

vocabulary.definition: a person who travels into space
vocabulary.example: The astronaut floated inside the space station

vocabulary.definition: a round hole made when something hits a planet or moon
vocabulary.example: The moon has many craters from space rocks

vocabulary.definition: the force that pulls things down toward a planet
vocabulary.example: Gravity keeps us from floating away from Earth

vocabulary.definition: everything that exists in space, including all stars and planets
vocabulary.example: The universe is bigger than we can imagine

vocabulary.definition: a tool that makes faraway things look bigger and closer
vocabulary.example: We used a telescope to see the rings around Saturn

vocabulary.definition: a group of stars that make a pattern in the sky
vocabulary.example: The Big Dipper is a famous constellation

vocabulary.definition: an object that goes around a planet in space
vocabulary.example: The satellite helps us get TV signals from space

vocabulary.definition: having to do with the sun
vocabulary.example: All the planets in our solar system orbit the sun

vocabulary.definition: the layer of air around a planet
vocabulary.example: Earth's atmosphere protects us from space rocks

vocabulary.definition: an important job or trip with a special purpose
vocabulary.example: The space mission lasted six months

vocabulary.definition: to travel to new places to learn about them
vocabulary.example: Astronauts explore space to make new discoveries

vocabulary.definition: having to do with space and stars, or extremely large
vocabulary.example: The distances in space are astronomical

vocabulary.definition: a colorful cloud of gas and dust in space where stars are born
vocabulary.example: The Orion nebula glows with beautiful colors

vocabulary.definition: between or among the stars
vocabulary.example: Interstellar travel would take many years
